alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 29 at 10:04PM CDT until March 29 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Haskell County in west central Texas... Northern Throckmorton County in west central Texas... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 1002 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located in northeastern Haskell County 7 miles north of Irby, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Millers Creek Reservoir around 1015 PM CDT. Throckmorton around 1030 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Us- 183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line and The Intersection Of Us-380 And Highway 222. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
